review.title: Part of Speech Tagging of Marathi Text Using Trigram Method
review.abstract: In this paper we present a Marathi part of speech tagger. It is a morphologically rich language. It is spoken by the native people of Maharashtra. The general approach used for development of tagger is statistical using trigram Method. The main concept of trigram is to explore the most likely POS for a token based on given information of previous two tags by calculating probabilities to determine which is the best sequence of a tag. In this paper we show the development of the tagger. Moreover we have also shown the evaluation done.

sections.text: DOI: 10.5121 / ijait.2013.3203 35In this paper we present a marathon part of the language tag. It is morphologically rich and is spoken by the native people of Maharashtra. The general approach to the development of the tagger is the statistical use of the Trigram method. The main concept of Trigram is to examine the most likely POS for a token based on information from previous two tags by calculating probabilities to determine which is the best tag sequence. In this paper we show the development of the tagger. In addition, we have also shown the evaluation donation.KEYWORDS: Part of Speech Tagging, Stochastic Tagging, N-gram Modeling, Marathi

sections.heading: 1. INTRODUCTION
sections.text: Tagging is one of the simplest, most constant and statistical models for many NLP applications. Tagging at POS is an initial phase of linguistics, text analysis such as retrieving information, machine translators, text for speech synthesis, information extraction, etc. Tagging is a process of mapping words into a text that corresponds to a specific part of the language. A basic version of POS tagging is the identification of words as nouns, adjectives, etc. POS tagging can be seen as a simplified form of morphological analysis, in which it is just a matter of matching the word with an appropriate part of the language.

sections.heading: 5. OUR APPROACH
sections.text: In this thesis, we describe the trigram model for Marathi POS taggers. Our main goal is to perform POS tagging to determine the most likely tag sequence for a word, since the two preceding tags are given. For trigrams, the probability of a sequence is merely the product of the conditional probabilities of their trigrams. sections.heading: 7. CONCLUSION
sections.text: The POS tagger described here is very simple and efficient for automatic marking, but the morphological complexity of the Marathi makes it somewhat difficult. The performance of the current system is good and the results obtained with this method are excellent. In the future, we would like to improve the accuracy of our system by adding more marked sets to our training corpus.
